25.text: First in the spotlight tonight is Martin Wightman,

27.text: a retired civil servant from Bristol.

29.text: He's answering questions on the Apollo missions.

32.text: Next, Roger Canwell from Norwich on the Great Train Robbery.

35.text: Austin McHale is a teacher from Middlesex.

38.text: His specialist subject, Queens Park Rangers football club.

42.text: is a technical support agent from Bournemouth.

45.text: Her subject, Jonathan Kellerman's Alex Delaware novels.

60.text: Hello and welcome to Mastermind with me, John Humphrys.

64.text: Four contenders are waiting to take their place in the black chair.

68.text: It's not just about knowing the answers, of course.

73.text: The pressure of being in the spotlight and even worse,

76.text: knowing that the clock is ticking away

78.text: and does not allow you the luxury of thinking time.

80.text: As always, they get two minutes of questions

82.text: on their specialist subject and then two and a half on general knowledge.

86.text: The winner will go through to the next round

88.text: and take a step nearer to becoming the owner of a rather fine

90.text: glass bowl and far more importantly,

92.text: the prestige of becoming Mastermind champion.

95.text: So, let us have our first contender, please.
